dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3864726Z] accountnetzero.net - United Online, Inc.'s Trademark Right

19 Apr 2007 22:29:59 -0000 Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.102]) by DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 19 Apr 2007 17:29:59 -0500 Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 19 Apr 2007 17:29:58 -0500 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1177021787-8499-78-0 X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net Received: from SEAOWA04.sea.corp.int.untd.com (nat80.classmates.com [65.197.174.94]) by mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id 7CA40794F1; Thu, 19 Apr 2007 17:29:52 -0500 (CDT) Received: from SEAEVS02.sea.corp.int.untd.com ([172.20.80.9]) by SEAOWA04.sea.corp.int.untd.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 19 Apr 2007 15:29:36 -0700 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C782D2.36301A04" Disposition-Notification-To: "McGuane, Tara" X-ASG-Orig-Subj: accountnetzero.net - United Online, Inc.'s Trademark Rights Subject: accountnetzero.net - United Online, Inc.'s Trademark Rights Date: Thu, 19 Apr 2007 15:29:35 -0700 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: accountnetzero.net - United Online, Inc.'s Trademark Rights Thread-Index: AceC0jWjiAQdMh6bSXCercHYMAUGCg== From: "McGuane, Tara" To: Cc: , X-OriginalArrivalTime: 19 Apr 2007 22:29:36.0683 (UTC) FILETIME=[362A3FB0:01C782D2] X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 1.93 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=1.93 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED tests=DEAR_SOMETHING, HTML_NONELEMENT_60_70 X-Barracuda-Spam-Report: Code version 3.02, rules version 3.0.39935 Rule breakdown below pts rule name description ---- ---------------------- -------------------------------------------------- 1.61 DEAR_SOMETHING BODY: Contains 'Dear (something)' 0.32 HTML_NONELEMENT_60_70 BODY: 60% to 70% of HTML elements are non-standard Return-Path: TMcGuane@corp.untd.com (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) April 19, 2007 Re: United Online, Inc.'s Trademark Rights www.accountnetzero.net Dear Sir or Madam: I am the Senior Intellectual Property & Marketing Compliance Manager for United Online, Inc. ("United Online"), the parent company of NetZero, Inc. ("NetZero") and Juno Online Services, Inc. ("Juno"). I am writing to inform you that your use of the domain name "www.accountnetzero.net " for in your domain and on your website violates our exclusive rights to our Marks, and to demand that you immediately cease and desist from uses of such name in a manner which is confusingly similar to our Marks. We have the exclusive right to use our trademarks based on the following facts: NetZero has used its Marks for a significant period of time, primarily through its online service at www.netzero.net , and owns the federally registered trademarks NETZERO, Registration Nos. 2,382,595 and 2,304,296, NETZERO HISPEED, Registration No. 2,899,543, and JUNO, Registration No. 2164956. The Marks are distinctive, and well advertised on the web and other media. Your use of our name in your domain is a violation of our rights to the Marks, and constitutes federal and state trademark infringement, as well as unfair competition and dilution of our name. Additionally, your use of a confusingly similar spelling of our Marks is a clear violation of the Anticybersquatting Consumer Protection Act of 1999, which would subject you to statutory damages, and attorney fees should United Online be required to seek a permanent injunction against your continuing use of the domain name www.accountnetzero.net . Shields v. Zuccarini, 254 F.3d 476 (3d Cir. 2001). Similar activity has been cause for the transfer of domain names under the Uniform Domain Name Dispute Resolution Policy. Dow Jones & Co v. Zuccarini, WIPO Administrative Decision D2000-0578. While we understand that you may have registered the above domain name without full knowledge of the law in this area and United Online respects your right of expression and your desire to conduct business on the Internet, we must enforce our own rights in order to protect our valuable and famous trademarks. For these reasons, and to avoid consumer confusion, we must insist that you cease using the accountnetzero.net domain and transfer it to our possession. Your failure to comply with our request will result in United Online taking all necessary legal actions against you in the protection of our rights By providing you with this notice and clarifying our trademark rights, we trust that you will promptly cease your unauthorized use and that we may each continue to pursue our businesses and interests without necessity of legal action. Sincerely, ______________________________ Tara McGuane Sr. IP and Marketing Compliance Manager United Online, Inc. 2001 Lind Avenue SW, Suite 500 Renton, WA 98057 T: 425.917.4777 F: 425.271.5595 TMcGuane@corp.untd.com This transmission is intended for the sole use of the individual(s) to whom it is addressed and may contain information that is proprietary, privileged, attorney work product or otherwise exempt from disclosure. Please contact the sender if this transmission is received in error and immediately delete this message and its attachments from your system. Unauthorized use is prohibited. MIME element (text/html)

April 19, 2007

 

 

Re:    &nb sp; United Online, Inc.’s Trademark Rights

www.accountnetzero.net

 

 

Dear Sir or Madam:

 

I am the Senior Intellectual Property & Marketing Compliance Manager for United Online, Inc. (“United Online”), the parent company of NetZero, Inc. (“NetZero”) and Juno Online Services, Inc. (“Juno”). I am writing to inform you that your use of the domain name “www.accountnetzero.net” for in your domain and on your website violates our exclusive rights to our Marks, and to demand that you immediately cease and desist from uses of such name in a manner which is confusingly similar to our Marks.

 

We have the exclusive right to use our trademarks based on the following facts: NetZero has used its Marks for a significant period of time, primarily through its online service at www.netzero.net, and owns the federally registered trademarks NETZERO, Registration Nos. 2,382,595 and 2,304,296, NETZERO HISPEED, Registration No. 2,899,543, and JUNO, Registration No. 2164956.  The Marks are distinctive, and well advertised on the web and other media. Your use of our name in your domain is a violation of our rights to the Marks, and constitutes federal and state trademark infringement, as well as unfair competition and dilution of our name.

 

Additionally, your use of a confusingly similar spelling of our Marks is a clear violation of the Anticybersquatting Consumer Protection Act of 1999, which would subject you to statutory damages, and attorney fees should United Online be required to seek a permanent injunction against your continuing use of the domain name www.accountnetzero.net.  Shields v. Zuccarini, 254 F.3d 476 (3d Cir. 2001).  Similar activity has been cause for the transfer of domain names under the Uniform Domain Name Dispute Resolution Policy.  Dow Jones & Co v. Zuccarini, WIPO Administrative Decision D2000-0578. 

 

While we understand that you may have registered the above domain name without full knowledge of the law in this area and United Online respects your right of expression and your desire to conduct business on the Internet, we must enforce our own rights in order to protect our valuable and famous trademarks. For these reasons, and to avoid consumer confusion, we must insist that you cease using the accountnetzero.net domain and transfer it to our possession. Your failure to comply with our request will result in United Online taking all necessary legal actions against you in the protection of our rights

 

By providing you with this notice and clarifying our trademark rights, we trust that you will promptly cease your unauthorized use and that we may each continue to pursue our businesses and interests without necessity of legal action.

 

Sincerely,

______________________________
Tara McGuane
Sr. IP and Marketing Compliance Manager
United Online, Inc. 
2001 Lind Avenue SW, Suite 500< /U1:ADDRESS>
Renton, WA 98057
T: 425.917.4777
F: 425.271.5595
TMcGuane@corp.untd.com< /font>

Please contact the sender if this transmission is received in error and immediately delete this message and its attachments from your system. Unauthorized use is prohibited.
